title: Pixel 3 in reboot loop; UBreakIFix official diagnosis: Motherboard Issue -- now what?
content:
Hi there,

1. My Pixel 3 started in a reboot loop.
2. I contacted Google Support
3. I was able to Factory Data Reset the device.
4. The reboot loop continued --> therefore, it's a hardware issue (link: https://imgur.com/vsdq90m)
5. Since my phone is out of warranty, tech support directed me to UBreakIFix (3rd party tech support partner)
6. I brought my Pixel 3 to UBreakIFix
7. Technician at UBreakIFix conducted a diagnostics test, thought it might be the battery, replaced battery, reboot loop problem persisted.
8. UBreakIFix official diagnosis was a Motherboard issue
9. Went back to Google Support, was told there's nothing they can do. 

My phone is only 18 months old. I've done *everything* in my power to fix this device but it's a hardware issue that cannot be fixed. Google's own 3rd party repair provider said as much. 

So what am I supposed to do at this point?
